titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid for the Carol Sullivan letters

profiledesc.creation: Encoded finding aid created from MARC record by Dallas Pillen
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is written in English

descgrp.accessrestrict: The collection is open for research use.

archdesc.bioghist: Secretary at Rackham School of Graduate Studies, University of Michigan. Her mother, Mrs. Leo Rockwell, was house director of the English Language Institute House.
archdesc.scopecontent: Loose leaf letters, mostly handwritten, few typed, from Carol Sullivan to her husband Jim Sullivan during his military service, notably in the Philippines, 1942-1945. Also a list of occupants of apartment 7 at 314 North Ingalls in Ann Arbor, Mich., and a list of administrative staff in the Horace H. Rackham School of Graduate Studies, the University of Michigan. People on the lists are mentioned in letters.

corpname.primary_name: Horace H. Rackham School of Graduate Studies
Horace H. Rackham School of Graduate Studies
